How a person is ailing in body and ailin: An uneducated ordinary person has not seen the noble ones
They are neither skilled nor trained in the qualities of a noble one
They have not seen good persons
They are neither skilled nor trained in the qualities of a good person
They regard form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness as self, or self as having them
The decay and perishing of form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness give rise to sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress
How a person is ailing in body and healt: An educated noble disciple has seen the noble ones
They are skilled and trained in the teaching of the noble ones
They are skilled and trained in the teaching of the good persons
They do not regard form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness as self, or self as having them
The decay and perishing of form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness do not give rise to sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress.
